name: Favicon Fetcher (Manual/In-Memory)
description: A service to fetch favicons. Deploys in in-memory mode by default, but can connect to an external Redis if you provide a REDIS_URL.

NODE_ENV.description: Sets the application environment to production. Should not be changed.

REDIS_URL.description: (Optional) The full connection URL for an external Redis instance. IMPORTANT: If your password contains special characters (@, :, /, #, ?), they MUST be URL-encoded (e.g., a password like 'p@ss#word' becomes 'p%40ss%23word'). Leave blank to use in-memory mode.

LIMIT_SEPARATOR.description: The character used to separate multiple rate limit rules. Heroku supports the default comma.

CACHE_ENABLED.description: Enables or disables caching ('true'/'false'). Recommended to keep enabled.

CACHE_TTL_SECONDS.description: Cache expiration time in seconds. Default is 86400 (24 hours).

REQ_TIMEOUT_MS.description: Milliseconds to wait for target sites before timing out. Default is 5000 (5 seconds).

HTML_PAYLOAD_LIMIT.description: Max HTML size to download in bytes. Default is 250000 (250KB).

ICON_PAYLOAD_LIMIT.description: Max icon file size to download in bytes. Default is 2097152 (2MB).

CUSTOM_USER_AGENT.description: Optional: Override the default User-Agent string used for making requests.

AUTHN0.description: Example API key. You can create more by adding AUTHN1, AUTHN2, etc. in the Heroku dashboard after deployment.

LIMIT0.description: Example rate limit for AUTHN0. Format is a comma-separated list of 'unit:value' (e.g., 'rps:10,rpm:500').

LIMITA.description: Global rate limit for all anonymous users. Format is 'unit:value' list.

LIMITI.description: Per-IP rate limit for anonymous users, applied in addition to LIMITA. Format is 'unit:value' list.
